Name: Amenemhat III
Description: This statue is larger than life-size. Only the head and part of the upper torso and arms are preserved. The facial features are also damaged, giving the face a rather rough expression. The broad nose is almost completely broken away. The lips are pressed together and lack contour. The king is depicted in the royal head-dress or Nemes and uraeus. The upper arms hug the sides of the body. A necklace of tubular beads and an amulet have been carved in very low relief.
